byline.contributor: Peter Baker reported from Washington, and Michael R. Gordon from New York. Helene Cooper and Gardiner Harris contributed reporting from Washington.
byline.original: By PETER BAKER and MICHAEL R. GORDON

abstract: Pres Barack Obama will formally meet in New York with Russian president Vladimir V Putin, in first meeting between leaders since June 2013; Russia's recent assertions of power led to strained relationship between men; talks, which are at Putin's behest, are expected to focus on Russia's actions in Syria and Ukraine and gauge extent of overlap between two countries' interests.
lead_paragraph: Officials indicated that Mr. Obama agreed to meet in the hopes of using the opportunity to press the Russian leader on Ukraine and Syria.

headline.main: White House Says President Obama and Vladimir Putin Will Meet Next Week
headline.print_headline: Obama and Putin Will Meet in New York, Ending Long Lull

snippet: Officials indicated that Mr. Obama agreed to meet in the hopes of using the opportunity to press the Russian leader on Ukraine and Syria.
